definition: when you teach someone, both teacher and student will benefit
appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)
each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])

sentences.english: This, as they say, is a teaching moment.
sentences.chinese: 奧運會，正如他們所說，是個教學相長的時刻。

sentences.english: This means that teaching something to another person can help you to learn a subject well.
sentences.chinese: 這可能是他說出“教學相長”的原因。

sentences.english: On the other hand I also realize to learn while teaching profoundly of deep content.
sentences.chinese: 另一方面我也深深地體會到教學相長的深刻內涵。

definition: It takes ten years to nurture a tree, but a hundred years to train a man (idiom)/fig. a good education program takes a long time to develop/cf. 十年樹木，百年樹人|十年树木，百年树人
to be at the highest level of enlightenment (Buddhist expression)
after that, any remaining energy (idiom from Analects); time for extracurricular activities
so dedicated as to forget one's meals (idiom)
to choose what is good and hold fast to it (idiom)
lit. opening a book is profitable (idiom); the benefits of education
to follow through/to carry through to the end
(Tw) to guide sb in the right direction/to correct (behavior etc)
